entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I smoke in the hostel?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
Smoking is not permitted in any area of the hostel, including in rooms and on common area terraces.

This policy is strictly enforced, and guests who are unable to follow it will be asked to leave. We understand that this policy may not suit everyone, so we ask that you consider this before booking a stay with us.

entries.s2: i want to vape
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I vape in the hostel?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: You are allowed to vape on the common room terrace or on the balcony of your own room (where available). Please do not vape inside the hostel.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I smoke cannabis?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Cannabis is only legally sold in Italy for medical or industrial use. Smoking cannabis at the hostel is strictly prohibited, and we request that you do not bring cannabis into the hostel or smoke it in the surrounding area.  We understand that this policy may not suit everyone, so we ask that you consider this before booking a stay with us.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I bring my own alcohol?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
We ask that guests do not bring alcohol purchased outside of the hostel into the hostel or consume it on the premises.

This policy is strictly enforced, and guests who are unable to follow it will be asked to leave. We understand that this policy may not suit everyone, so we ask that you consider this before booking a stay with us.

entries.s2: what time must stop making noise
entries.humanReadableQuestion: When does noise restriction start and what does it mean?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
The town of Positano has a noise restriction that begins at midnight, which is enforced by the local police. The hostel has a noise restriction that starts at 11:45pm, at which time we ask guests to maintain a conversational volume and turn off any music.

If a guest is unable to follow the hostel's noise restrictions, we may ask them to leave. We understand that noise restrictions may not suit everyone, so we ask that you consider this before booking a stay with us.

entries.s2: what time must shut off music
entries.s3: what time must turn off music
entries.s4: what time must stop playing music
entries.s5: what time must reduce music volume
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can we play music and if so until what time at night?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
Music can be played until 11:45pm. After this time, Positano's town hall has a noise restriction in place. While we understand that some guests may wish to play music quietly after this time, we cannot allow it for three reasons: 1) Quiet music often leads to louder-than-conversational talking;
2) What one person considers quiet may not be perceived as such by others, particularly after consuming alcohol; and
3) Quiet music may gradually get turned up in volume over time. We enforce this policy and may ask guests to leave if they are unable to follow it.

If a guest is unable to follow the hostel's noise restrictions, we may ask them to leave. We understand that noise restrictions may not suit everyone, so we ask that you consider this before booking a stay with us.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: When does the bar close?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
The hostel is licensed to serve drinks 24 hours a day, but we typically call last orders at 11:30pm ahead of the town's noise restriction kicking-in at 11:45pm. This helps us to comply with the town's regulations and also accommodates the needs of guests who want to sleep after midnight. If you'd like to have a drink later at night, you can visit one of the beach bars or the nightclub on the main beach, which are not subject to the same noise restriction and remain open after that time.

If a guest is unable to follow the hostel's noise restrictions, we may ask them to leave. We understand that noise restrictions may not suit everyone, so we ask that you consider this before booking a stay with us.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: What happens if I break hostel rules?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: At our hostel, we rely on our guests to follow the rules and regulations that are in place to ensure the safety and comfort of all guests. We trust that our guests will do their part to maintain a respectful and orderly environment. However, if a guest demonstrates that they will not follow the hostel rules, we may ask them to leave in order to protect the well-being of other guests and the overall functioning of the hostel. entries.humanReadableQuestion: Is the hostel's water drinkable?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
The tap water at the hostel is safe to drink. It is safe to drink as delivered by the water company that supplies the hostel. However, the hostel filters the water we receive, improving its quality and reducing its hardness.

For your convenience we also keep a water cooler stocked with drinking water at the bar area.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where is the guest kitchen?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: The hostel does not have a kitchen available for guests to use. However, we can provide plates, knives and forks, salt and pepper, and a microwave for heating up food. We can also provide hot water upon request. Please let us know if you need any assistance or have any special requests.

entries.s2: do you separate out rubbish
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Does the hostel separate out rubbish/recycle?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Yes, we have a system in place for properly dividing and disposing of rubbish. All rubbish is divided into one of five categories: paper, plastic, glass/bottles, organic, and miscellaneous. By separating our waste in this way, we are able to recycle as much as possible and reduce our impact on the environment. Thank you for your cooperation in helping us maintain a clean and sustainable hostel.

entries.humanReadableAnswer:

1. The communal terrace has bins.
2. Each room has a bin/trash can for your convenience.
3. If you need assistance disposing of large or heavy items, you can hand them to staff and we will take care of it for you.

Thank you for helping us keep the hostel clean and tidy.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I bring a friend / relative / etc to the hostel?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
We prioritize the safety and security of our guests.

This means ensuring that only registered guests are on the premises and assessing their competency to be on the premises on an ongoing basis. As a result, we cannot accommodate people who are not staying at the hostel, including providing them with breakfast, drinks at the bar, or other daily hostelling services. In support of this policy, we ask that our guests do not bring non-guest visitors to the hostel, and we enforce this policy strictly. If a guest is unable to follow this policy, we may ask them to leave. We understand that this policy may not be acceptable to everyone, so we ask that you consider this before booking a stay with us.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation in maintaining the safety and security of our hostel.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where is the nearest laundrette?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: The nearest laundrette to our hostel is called L'Arcobaleno Di Ruggiero Giuseppina & C. Sas, and it is located 350 meters or 1150 feet from the hostel. The laundrette's opening hours may vary throughout the year, so we recommend checking their Google business listing for the most up-to-date information. One convenient option when using the laundrette is to drop off your laundry, go out for the day, and then collect it at the end of the day. The laundrette staff will wash, dry, and package your clothes for you. While you can save money by washing your clothes yourself, the machines at the laundrette tend to be busy, so it may be more convenient to have the staff take care of your laundry for you.

entries.s2: where can guests wash their clothes
entries.s4: where can i wash my clothes
entries.s5: how can i wash clothes
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where is the hostel's washing machine?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
As per our advertised list of facilities, the hostel does not have laundry facilities on site. This is due to limited space for both washing and drying facilities.

The nearest laundrette is located within 350 meters or 1150 feet of the hostel. It is called L'Arcobaleno Di Ruggiero Giuseppina & C. Sas, and it is located 350 meters or 1150 feet from the hostel. The laundrette's opening hours may vary throughout the year, so we recommend checking their Google business listing for the most up-to-date information. One convenient option when using the laundrette is to drop off your laundry, go out for the day, and then collect it at the end of the day. The laundrette staff will wash, dry, and package your clothes for you. While you can save money by washing your clothes yourself, the machines at the laundrette tend to be busy, so it may be more convenient to have the staff take care of your laundry for you. Thank you for considering this option during your stay with us.

Thank you for your understanding.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where can I dry my towel?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
If you need to hang your towel to dry, there are a few options to consider depending on the amenities in your room. Here are a two things to keep in mind:

If your room has a terrace, you can hang your towel to dry there. This is a convenient and effective way to dry your things.
If your room does not have a terrace, you can hang your towel to dry in your room. Just be mindful of the space and layout of your room, and try to find a spot that is well-ventilated and out of the way.

We hope this helps with your laundry needs. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where can I store my bicycle on site?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: The closest place to park bicycles is located on the street above Positano's town hall, which is 90 meters or 270 feet from the hostel. Please note that these spaces are provided by Positano's town hall and not the hostel, and we cannot guarantee their availability or suitability for purpose.

entries.s4: find car parking
entries.s5: does the hostel have car parking spaces
entries.s6: i want to park my car
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where can I park my car?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
As per our advertised list of facilities, the hostel does not have a dedicated car parking space. Car parking spaces are expensive, with prices being 100,000 euros or so per space.

As an alternative, you may be able to park your car on the street for free, although it can be difficult to find a free parking spot during the peak summer months of June, July, and August. You can try searching for free parking near the bus stop located before the hostel (if you are driving from Naples/Sorrento to Positano). You can find this location by entering 'JFJG+2X Positano, Province of Salerno, Italy' into Google Maps. When parking on the street, be sure not to park on a bend in the road, in someone's driveway, or in a space reserved for tax officials or the police, as you may receive a parking ticket or have your car towed.

Car parking in commercial lots usually costs around 10 euros per hour. If you prefer the convenience of a paid parking lot, we have included links to the three closest car parks for your reference.

entries.s2: can the hostel change currency
entries.s4: i want to exchange money
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Does the hostel change money?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
The hostel only exchanges US Dollars. The exchange rate is based on the current rate quoted by Google, with an additional 5% added. The rate will be rounded up to the nearest 50 cents.

For other currencies, you may want to consider using an exchange service or withdrawing cash from an ATM, as this may be a more cost-effective option.

In either case you may prefer to use a Western Union. If so the nearest is located at a company called 'Mail Boxes Etc.'

entries.humanReadableAnswer: If you have U.S. dollars, we will be happy to exchange them for you so that you can make payment in Euros.  The exchange rate is based on the current rate quoted by Google, with an additional 5% added. The rate will be rounded up to the nearest 50 cents.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Does the hostel accept payment in foreign currency?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
The hostel can only accept payment in Euros.

If you have U.S. dollars, we will be happy to exchange them for you so that you can make payment in Euros. The exchange rate is based on the current rate quoted by Google, with an additional 5% added. The rate will be rounded up to the nearest 50 cents.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Why is Positano so expensive?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Real estate prices in Positano are amongst the highest in the world, with only a few places like Monaco being more expensive. As a result, the cost of living in Positano is relatively high.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Why is the hostel so expensive?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: During the summer months, the average price of accommodation per night in Positano is over 700 euros. We strive to provide good value for money to our guests and have received positive feedback. Due to the high demand to stay with us, we believe our hostel is a good value for the price we charge.

entries.s2: Does Positano have a city tax?
entries.humanReadableQuestion: How much is positano city tax?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Positano's City Tax is based on the type of accommodation and is charged per person. For example, the tax for a five-star hotel is higher than that for a four-star hotel. If two guests are staying in a double room, they will each be required to pay the tax.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: What is 'city tax'?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: City Tax in Italy was introduced through the Tax Federalism Act of 2011, which allows Town Halls to set their own rates and collection methods. The tax is charged per person, per night, and must be collected by the hostel at check-in on behalf of the Town Hall.  Collected City Tax is paid by The Hostel to Positano's Town Hall once per month.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: When do I pay city tax?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: If City Tax has not been paid prior to arrival, it must be paid upon arrival.

entries.s1: does hostel take a keycard deposit
entries.s2: is there a deposit for keycard/damages/etc?
entries.humanReadableQuestion: How much is the keycard/damages/etc deposit?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Upon check-in, a deposit of 10 euros per guest is required to cover the cost of bed sheets, a towel, a keycard, and any potential damages. This deposit will be refunded upon checkout, provided that all items are returned and there are no damages.

entries.s1: when do i have to pay the keycard deposit
entries.s2: when must i pay the keycard deposit
entries.s3: when do i want to pay the keycard deposit
entries.s4: why must i give the hostel a keycard deposit
entries.humanReadableQuestion: When must I give the hostel the keycard/damages/etc deposit?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
When you check in to our hostel, you'll be required to provide a security deposit. The deposit must be given in cash upon arrival. Here are a few things to keep in mind:

The deposit is 10 euros.
The deposit is held as a form of security to cover any potential damages or extra charges that may occur during your stay.
The deposit will be returned to you in full upon check-out, provided there are no damages or outstanding charges.

We hope this helps clarify the process for providing a security deposit.

entries.s1: do i have to pay the keycard deposit in cash
entries.s2: do i want to pay the keycard deposit in cash
entries.s3: why must i pay the keycard deposit in cash
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Why does the deposit have to be paid in cash?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
The deposit is a security measure, not a payment. It will be returned to you in cash upon checkout, provided that you return the keycard and there are no damages.

To avoid the added hassle and cost of administering credit card deposits, we ask for a cash deposit upon check-in. This allows us to maintain our room rates without charging an additional administration fee.

entries.s1: i want a bottom / top bunk bed
entries.s2: can i select a bottom / top bunk bed before i arrive
entries.s3: can i get a bottom / top bunk bed before i arrive
entries.s4: can i request a bottom / top bunk bed before i arrive
entries.s5: can i select a specific bunk bed
entries.s6: can i choose my bunk bed
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I request a bottom / top bunk bed?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
At our hostel, beds are allocated on a first-come, first-served basis. This means that we cannot guarantee specific bed assignments, including whether you'll be given a top or bottom bunk. Here are a few things to keep in mind:

When you check in, you'll be assigned a bed based on availability.
If another bed becomes available during your stay, you can move into that bed instead - just be sure to move your belongings to the new bed.
To ensure that we have an accurate count of available beds, we perform regular bed checks. Please be sure to keep your belongings on your assigned bed to avoid disrupting the bed check process.

We hope this helps clarify our bed assignment policy. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to ask.

entries.s2: mobility is a problem for me
entries.s4: i cannot climb ladder
entries.s5: i cannot climb onto top bunk bed
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I visit Positano if I have mobility problems?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: We regret to inform you that Positano may not be a suitable destination for those who have difficulty with mobility. The presence of stairs, limited space in shops, restaurants, and cafes, a lack of facilities, and limited transportation options make it challenging for those with mobility issues to fully enjoy Positano.

entries.s2: tell me how to checkout
entries.s4: i want to checkout
entries.s5: tell me how to checkout
entries.s6: tell me about the checkout process
entries.humanReadableQuestion: What must I do for checkout?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Please bring us the bed sheets, towel, and keycard. Place the bed sheets and towel in the basket near the bar area. Hand us the keycard for the room. At this point checkout is complete.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: What is the first time I can checkout?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Checkout commences at 7:30am. If you need to checkout before this time, please come and see us the night before. We will take you through the early checkout process and refund your keycard deposit. If you do not come to see us the night before, we will not be able to refund your keycard deposit.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: What is the last time I can checkout?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Checkout time is 10:30am. Please respect the needs of our cleaners and ensure that you checkout on time. After this time, they need to begin their work.

entries.s2: order late checkout
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I arrange a late checkout?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: We do not offer a late checkout service. Our cleaners need time to thoroughly clean every room every day. However, you can store your bags with us until 4:30pm on the day of checkout. To do so, please bring your bags to us when you checkout so that we can store them for you.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I store my luggage after checkout?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Yes, we will store your bags for you until 4:30pm on the day of checkout. Please bring them to us around checkout time if you would like to use this service.

entries.s2: tell me how to check in
entries.s4: i want to check in
entries.s5: tell me how to check in
entries.s6: tell me about the check in process
entries.humanReadableQuestion: What must I do for check in?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
We require photo identification (such as a passport, national identity card, services card, or driver's license), which we will use to take down some details. Room payment, city tax, and a security deposit of 10 euros (which must be paid in cash) must also be completed.

After this we will provide you with WiFi details, and our welcome video, and ask that you watch the video.

Once these steps are completed, we will assist you to your room.

entries.s2: first time check in
entries.s4: check-in
entries.s5: check-in time
entries.humanReadableQuestion: What is the first time I can check in?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Check-in time is 3pm.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: What is the last time I can check in?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Reception is open until 10:30pm. If you will be arriving after this time, we will need to coordinate with you to complete an out-of-hours check-in. This requires that we are able to take payment for the room in full (ie. if payment has not already been taken in full), and provide you with instructions on how to check in when reception is closed. Please contact us as soon as you know that you will not be able to arrive during regular check-in hours so that we can make the necessary arrangements for you.

entries.s2: order early check in
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I arrange early check in?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: We will check guests in once the cleaners have finished cleaning the room. While we guarantee that the room will be ready for check-in at 3pm, we cannot guarantee that check-in will be possible before this time. We can store bags and offer use of our facilities from 10:30am.

entries.s2: store bags before check in
entries.s4: store bags before check-in
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I store my luggage before check in?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Yes, we can store bags from 10:30am on check-in day.

entries.s2: where can i get cutlery
entries.s4: where can i get knife
entries.s5: where can i get spoon
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I borrow cutlery?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Yes, we ask that you do not take the cutlery to your room. Please return it to us at the bar/reception area and we will wash it for you.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I use a microwave?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Please bring us any items that you would like to be microwaved and we will heat them for you.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I borrow a plate?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Yes, we ask that you do not take the plate to your room. Please return it to us at the bar/reception area and we will wash it for you.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I borrow a bowl?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Yes, we ask that you do not take the bowl to your room. Please return it to us at the bar/reception area and we will wash it for you.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Can I use a napkin / paper towel?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: Yes, you can request them at the bar/reception area.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: How often is the hostel cleaned?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
Cleanliness is a top priority. We have a team of full-time, professionally trained cleaners who work hard to ensure all rooms and common areas are thoroughly cleaned every day.

If you have a private room and would prefer to opt out of daily cleaning, please let us know. We are happy to accommodate your preferences and ensure your stay is as comfortable as possible.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Should we rent a car?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
Driving in Southern Italy can be a unique experience compared to other places you may be used to. Here are a few things to keep in mind:

The roads may be narrower than what you're used to, so be extra cautious and patient.
The driving style in Southern Italy may seem chaotic to some visitors. Try to stay calm and take extra care when driving.
Finding parking along the coast can be challenging and costly. It may be worth considering alternative modes of transportation, such as public transportation or taxi services.

To request a taxi, you can use WhatsApp to contact the following number in either English or Italian: +39 379 125 6222.

Please see our guide for more information.
entries.linkText1: Guide: Arriving by car, including parking

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Should we come to Positano by car?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
Driving in Southern Italy can be a unique experience compared to other places you may be used to. Here are a few things to keep in mind:

The roads may be narrower than what you're used to, so be extra cautious and patient.
The driving style in Southern Italy may seem chaotic to some visitors. Try to stay calm and take extra care when driving.
Finding parking along the coast can be challenging and costly. It may be worth considering alternative modes of transportation, such as public transportation or taxi services.

To request a taxi, you can use WhatsApp to contact the following number in either English or Italian: +39 379 125 6222.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where is the breakfast menu?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
If you have a meal plan, you will receive an email with a link to an interactive menu where you can place your order. If the meal plan was included as part of your room booking, the email will have been sent to the person who made the booking. Please ask them to forward it to you so you can access the menu.

Please note that the pay-as-you-go breakfast menu is separate from the complimentary menu. You can find a link to this menu below.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where can I order breakfast?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
If you have a meal plan, you will receive an email with a link to an interactive menu where you can place your order. If the meal plan was included as part of your room booking, the email will have been sent to the person who made the booking. Please ask them to forward it to you so you can access the menu.

Please note that the pay-as-you-go breakfast menu is separate from the complimentary menu. You can find a link to this menu below. Place your order in the morning at the bar area.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: What time is breakfast served?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
Breakfast orders can be placed from 8 am each day.

Last breakfast orders are taken at 10:30am.

If you have a meal plan, you will receive an email with a link to an interactive menu where you can place your order. Be sure to use the menu to place your order the day before i.e. order Tuesday's breakfast on Monday.

entries.humanReadableQuestion: What are Meal Plans?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: The hostel offers meal plans, which are the cheapest way of ordering food and drink.  Please see our meal plan guide for more information.  Come see us and place your order for a meal plan at the bar area.

entries.s2: I want help and everything is closed
entries.s4: i want a medic
entries.s5: i have an emergency situation
entries.s6: what to do in a medical emergency
entries.humanReadableQuestion: I have an emergency and the reception / bar area is closed.
entries.humanReadableAnswer: In the case of an emergency, please WhatsApp us immediately at the following emergency number: +39 392 929 3384. Someone from our team will come to assist you as soon as possible. Please do not hesitate to call for help if you need it. Your safety is our top priority.

entries.s2: where can i find a bank
entries.s4: where can i find the nearest cashpoint
entries.s5: how can i find a cashpoint
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where is the nearest cashpoint, and will it charge me a withdrawal fee?
entries.humanReadableAnswer: The nearest ATM is located just 70 meters (210 feet) away and does not charge any fees for withdrawals.

entries.s2: where can i exchange money
entries.s4: how can i exchange money
entries.s5: where is the nearest place to change money
entries.s6: where is the nearest place to exchange money
entries.humanReadableQuestion: Where can I change money?
entries.humanReadableAnswer:
You can exchange U.S. dollars at the hostel. The exchange rate is based on the current rate quoted by Google, with an additional 5% added. The rate will be rounded up to the nearest 50 cents.

If you prefer, the nearest Western Union is located at a company called 'Mail Boxes Etc.'.
